stories.title: One Chaste Marriage, Four Kids, and the Catholic Church

stories.text:
Does anyone have a link to this old HN/blog story, where the author was MIT email support and their professors'/clients found only email recipients within 600 miles could receive their emails. Turned out the emails were limited by some bounce-back timer, I don't recall the specifics, but that window times the speed of light = 600 miles.

I'd love to share the link today so I don't sound crazy for mentioning a crazy tech bug involving the speed of light to a colleague.
stories.title: Ask HN: MIT Story, Email Only Goes 600 Miles or Less?

stories.text: I have no idea how safe boot actually works, but if my industry lessons with cryptography is worth anything... there's an expiration date somewhere. At what point will safe boot just stop working?
